meanings.def: having a close and friendly relationship
examples: We're not on intimate terms with our neighbours.

meanings.def: private and personal, often in a sexual way
examples: The article revealed intimate details about his family life.
the most intimate parts of her body

meanings.def: encouraging close, friendly relationships, sometimes of a sexual nature
examples: He knew an intimate little bar where they would not be disturbed.
an intimate knowledge of the English countryside
an intimate connection between class and educational success

meanings.def: having a sexual relationship with somebody
to let somebody know what you think or mean
examples: intimate something (to somebody) He has already intimated to us his intention to retire.
intimate (that)… He has already intimated (that) he intends to retire.
He was a wartime minister and intimate of Churchill.
